item.title: In U.S. Fights Over Ukraine Aid, Allies Fear Deeper Global Harm
item.description: Washington has led the response to Russia, but domestic political spats are raising worries about U.S. commitment.

item.title: A New Interest-Rate Regime Has Begun. These Are the Market's Winners and Losers.
item.description: Bond prices, the Magnificent Seven and emerging markets are under pressure.

item.title: Congress Averts Shutdown in Surprise Breakthrough
item.description: The measure passed by the House and Senate includes $16 billion in disaster relief but omits aid for Ukraine and excludes border-security measures sought by Republicans.

item.title: Does China's Property Bust Make a Financial Crisis Inevitable?
item.description: Perhaps not—if Beijing plays its cards right. But serious damage to the nation’s prospects is still likely. A look at the problem in five charts.

item.title: Your Will Alone Won't Guarantee Your Money Goes to Your Heirs
item.description: Those beneficiary forms you filled out years ago can supersede your other estate plans.

item.title: How Stellantis and Its Not-So-Detroit CEO Are Taking On the UAW
item.description: The company and boss Carlos Tavares—both more European than American—are making progress with the union and avoiding more strikes for now.

item.title: Biden and Trump Woo the UAW in Michigan
item.description: A study of U.S. manufacturing decline shows the risks of too-costly union contracts.

item.description: The top college in America for making graduates richer

item.description: The era of peak TV is officially over&#x2014;and Hollywood will never be the same

item.title: Dramatic Day Ends in Fiery Altercations at the Ryder Cup
item.description: Heated arguments, tears and a long putt to win a match for the Americans produced fireworks on the second day of the U.S. vs. Europe competition.

item.title: How Polarization Sent Washington to the Brink of a Shutdown
item.description: GOP rebels, fueled by social media and online fundraising, feel empowered to block their leaders from cutting deals with Democrats.

item.title: A Workout to Help Runners Increase Miles and Avoid Injury
item.description: A long-distance expert offers advice to stay on course during training for marathon season.

item.title: Apple to Address iPhone 15 Overheating Issues in iOS 17 Software Update
item.description: The company says the new titanium design has no impact on heat and attributes the issue to bugs.

item.title: iPhone 15 Pro Owners Complain About Overheating Problems
item.description: The issue threatens Apple’s premium phones, a cash cow essential to its growth and profits.

item.title: France Probes Bernard Arnault Over Deal With Russian Businessman
item.description: Prosecutors say a preliminary investigation into money laundering has been under way since 2022 into the LVMH chief.

item.title: U.S. Seeks to Calm Tensions in Balkans
item.description: NATO boosted its presence in the area following a fierce battle between Serbian gunmen and Kosovo police, the worst violence in years in the region.

item.title: Walmart Changes Pay and Titles for Corporate Staff
item.description: About 4% of corporate workers will receive a reduction in stock compensation as part of a reorganization.

item.title: Will America's Largest Local Sports Broadcaster Survive?
item.description: Diamond Sports is grappling with high-stakes carriage and rights negotiations ahead of the NBA and NHL seasons.

item.title: A New Nimbyism Blocks Carbon Pipelines
item.description: Projects for burying carbon emissions are under pressure in the Midwest, spelling challenges ahead for a massive infrastructure buildup.

item.description: It was the Lamborghini he&#x27;d waited 44 years for. Then, finally, the phone rang.
